conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball and its shadow on the wall.
The ball is thrown vertically upward with an initial velocity v_0.
The vertical position y(t) of the ball is y(t) = v_0 t - (1/2) g t^2.
The shadow of the ball is formed by the projection onto the wall through the point light source.
x is the horizontal distance from the light source to the midpoint; L is the distance from the light source to the wall.
The distance from the midpoint to the wall is L/2.
Given x = L/2, Y(t)/y(t) = 2, thus Y(t) = 2 y(t).
Substituting y(t), Y(t) = 2 v_0 t - g t^2.
The initial velocity of the shadow is the derivative of Y(t) with respect to t at t = 0.
The initial velocity of the shadow is 2 v_0.
